item.title: String Theory
item.description:
String Theory

Why limit yourself to four dimensions? Buy now your string theory fabric. Vibrating strings form an 11 dimensional supersymmetric fabric of bosons and fermions. Choose your vibrational state, now including gravitons. Vacuum state is not in stock at the moment.

Available in type I, type IIA, type IIB, and two flavors of heterotic string theory (SO(32) and E8×E8) The different theories allow different types of strings, and the particles that arise at low energies exhibit different symmetries. The type I theory includes both open strings (which are segments with endpoints) and closed strings (which form closed loops), while types IIA, IIB and heterotic include only closed strings.

item.title: Causal Sets
item.description:
Causal Sets

Continuous space is out of fashion, there is no meaning to distance at scales smaller than the Planck scale (~10−35 meters). The trend now is granular space, a direct consequence of the quantization. We use the latest technology to present here an extremely fine fabric or network "woven" of finite loops, called spin networks. LQG is formally background independent. The equations of LQG are not embedded in, or dependent on, space-time (except for its invariant topology). Instead, they are expected to give rise to space-time at distances which are large compared to the Planck length.

Available in Traditional canonical loop quantum gravity or spin foam theory.

item.title: Loop Quantum Gravity
item.description:
Loop Quantum Gravity

Continuous space is out of fashion, there is no meaning to distance at scales smaller than the Planck scale (~10−35 meters). The trend now is granular space, a direct consequence of the quantization. We use the latest technology to present here an extremely fine fabric or network "woven" of finite loops, called spin networks. LQG is formally background independent. The equations of LQG are not embedded in, or dependent on, space-time (except for its invariant topology). Instead, they are expected to give rise to space-time at distances which are large compared to the Planck length.

Available in Traditional canonical loop quantum gravity or spin foam theory.
